intro: Marrubium libanoticum, commonly known as the Lebanon horehound, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, gray-green leaves and small blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in mountainous areas. It is known for its medicinal properties, particularly in traditional herbal remedies. Its name reflects its historical association with the Lebanon region and its use in ancient herbal practices.
